1.title: Latrell James

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

1.plot: Boston's own rising star Latrell James performs live at WGBH's Fraser Performance Studio.

2.title: Brent Cowles

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

2.plot: Fresh off spending two weeks at a songwriting workshop on Nantucket, Denver-based singer-songwriter Brent Cowles joined us in our Fraser Performance Studio. Cowles achieved minor success with the band You, Me and Apollo then set out on a solo career.

3.title: Belly

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

3.plot: Tanya Donelly (Throwing Muses, Breeders) formed Belly in 1992. Their debut album, Star, went gold propelled by the hit single, Feed the Tree. The group disbanded in 1996, but they reunited in 2016 and released their new album, Dove, this year. A sold out crowd came out on a rainy Tuesday night here in our intimate Fraser Performance Studio to reminisce with the old classics and take in the new.

4.title: Mandolin Orange

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

4.plot: Singer-songwriter Andrew Marlin and multi-instrumentalist Emily Frantz formed Mandolin Orange in Chapel Hill, NC back in 2009. In the years since they've built a steady and sizable fan base around their unique blend of Americana, bluegrass, folk, gospel, country, and pop. A few hundred fortunate WGBH members got the chance to experience this special performance by Andrew and Emily (along with their full touring band) in our intimate Fraser Performance Studio.

5.title: Anjimile

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

5.plot: Anjimile performs live at WGBH's Fraser Performance Studio. Anjimile is a Boston-based queer and trans song maker raised in the suburbs of Richardson, Texas. As a first-generation Malawian-American their experiences with racism, homophobia and xenophobia in the deep south helped to form the basis of their politics and music.

6.title: Sam Trump

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

6.plot: Sam Trump performs live at WGBH's Fraser Performance Studio. Sam "Trump" Harris is a multi-instrumentalist/singer/songwriter from Houston, TX. Upon moving to Chicago in 2009 Sam quickly become involved in Chicago's live music scene as a band leader, collaborator, mentor and curator.

7.title: Neave Trio

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

7.plot: Boston-based critically acclaimed Neave Trio perform Astor Piazzolla's, Las cuatro estaciones porteñas live in WGBH's Fraser Performance Studio.

8.title: Henry Jamison

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

8.plot: Henry Jamison performs a number of songs off his new album, Gloria Duplex (released Feb 8, 2019), live in WGBH's Fraser Performance Studio.

1.title: SYML

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

1.plot: On a rain-soaked Sunday evening, Seattle-based SYML (Brian Fennell) performs live in the Fraser Performance Studio at WGBH in Boston. We got a chance to sit down with SYML before the show to talk about his search for identity and how that search has inspired his music. He also shares the story behind his stage moniker and some of the funnier made-up acronyms for SYML.

2.title: Sidney Gish

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

2.plot: New Jersey native, and third-year music industry major at Northeastern University, Sidney Gish, performs live in the Fraser Performance Studio at WGBH.

3.title: Julie Rhodes

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

3.plot: Boston native Julie Rhodes told us before her recent set in our Live at Fraser series that her musical career started "on a whim". After singing along in the audience at a house show, she was given some words of encouragement to write her own songs. That night, she began writing her first song and before long she was recording her debut album with producer Jonah Tolchin. She released Bound to Meet the Devil in 2016 and it's clear this is an artist ready to break out.

4.title: The Devil's Twins

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

4.plot: Boston-based The Devil's Twins exhibit catchy, yet haunting, dueling vocals by Nikki Coogan and Jeremiah Louf- atop a wall of sound generated by one guitar. The press and their underground cult following-The 2crew-describe their sound as "noir punk". Nikki and Jeremiah were joined on stage by a number of accomplished Boston musicians for this one-of-a-kind live performance at WGBH's Fraser Performance Studio.

5.title: Jamila Woods

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

5.plot: Jamila Woods stripped down to the basics delivered one unforgettable Live at Fraser performance. With just bass, guitar, and her incredible voice, the lyrical poet blew us away performing songs from her debut release, HEAVN.

6.title: Hayley Sabella

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

6.plot: Hayley Sabella returned to WGBH's Fraser Performance studio to perform a couple of songs from her upcoming EP release. She sat down with us to talk about the story behind these new songs before taking the stage.

7.title: The Seamus Egan Project

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

7.plot: Egan has inspired multiple generations of musicians and helped define the sound of Irish music today. As a composer, he was behind the soundtrack for the award-winning film The Brothers McMullen, co-wrote Sarah McLachlan's breakout hit, "Weep Not for the Memories," and has scored numerous documentaries and indie films since. As a bandleader, Solas has been the pre-eminent Irish-American band of their generation for the past 20 years, continuously renewing Irish music with fresh ideas. In 2018, Seamus launched his latest musical creation teaming up with a stellar group...

8.title: Jha D

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

8.plot: Boston-based spoken word artist, Jha D, kicked off the night with an extraordinary spoken word set. She was introduced by our supporting partners for the evening, BAMSfest.

9.title: The Shacks

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

9.plot: The dreamy retro-rock sound of The Shacks, led by guitarist/songwriter Max Shrager and lead vocalist Shannon Wise, perform live at WGBH's Fraser Performance studio. "There's a certain way we think about our music that allows it to be really intimate, and that's an important part of who we are as a band," reflects Shrager. "We try to think of our music as an extension of our lives, and maybe that's a cliché, but I think it's something that's actually lost in the world these days."

10.title: Aubrey Haddard

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

10.plot: Born and raised in the Hudson River Valley of New York, Aubrey Haddard now performs consistently throughout the North East. Once relocating to Boston, Haddard was awarded 'Massachusetts Solo Artist of the Year' Bridging the Music Productions, and has become the front woman of the Boston-based original funk group The New Review, heralding recognition from the illustrious NPR Tiny Desk Competition stating "it sounds like she's about to catch fire."

11.title: Brooke Annibale

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

11.plot: Singer-songwriter/guitarist Brooke Annibale plays a number of tracks from her new record, Hold to The Light, produced by Sam Kassirer (Josh Ritter, Lake Street Dive). Hold to The Light marks several major departures for Brooke in terms of both songwriting and production.

12.title: The Tree That Falls

episode of.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (TV Series 2017– )

12.plot: The Tree That Falls perform live at WGBH's Fraser Performance Studio. Cellist Cristobal Cruz-Garcia and guitarist John Shafer met at Boston's Berklee College of Music. TTTF incorporates the modern finger-style technique for both guitar and cello, while taking influence from a wide variety of world styles and genres.

imdb.plot outline: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser is a new series from WGBH and the producers of their Emmy® award winning series Front Row Boston that features intimate concert experiences with the most talented and promising artists, from across a wide range of music genres including Celtic, classical, jazz and rock. Set in the acoustically pristine Fraser Performance Studio at WGBH, and in front of a live audience, the show combines performances by local and national legends, and emerging talents, along with casual conversation in an energetic atmosphere, allowing artists to engage with their audiences all around Boston.
imdb.title: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser
akas: Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser (United States)
plot: _Front Row Boston: Live at Fraser_ (qv) is a new series from WGBH and the producers of their Emmy® award winning series Front Row Boston that features intimate concert experiences with the most talented and promising artists, from across a wide range of music genres including Celtic, classical, jazz and rock. Set in the acoustically pristine Fraser Performance Studio at WGBH, and in front of a live audience, the show combines performances by local and national legends, and emerging talents, along with casual conversation in an energetic atmosphere, allowing artists to engage with their audiences all around Boston.
